text: Charcuterie is a French word that means cold cooked meats and the process of making them. Charcuterie often means food made from pork but not always. An example of a charcuterie meat is salami. A charcuterie platter or charcuterie board is a wooden board with these types of meats, crackers, fruits, nuts, etc. Category:Cooking Category:Meat dishes Category:Italian food Category:Portuguese food Category:French food Category:Pork
title: Charcuterie
